description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek φορβή (phorbḗ, “food”), from φέρβω (phérbō, “to feed”).

entries.meaning: (chiefly ecology) Any non-woody flowering plant that is not a graminoid (a grass, sedge, or rush).
examples: So younger is better and the part nearest the roots is better, but what makes life possible for the pronghorn is a supply of forbs—small broadleaf plants growing among the grasses.
